ResearchProjectDef.label: early gunpowder experiments
ResearchProjectDef.description: Learn to craft the first primitive firearms - hand cannons, gonnes, and fire lances. These crude but revolutionary weapons mark the dawn of the gunpowder age, forever changing warfare and hunting.

ResearchProjectDef.label: matchlock mechanisms
ResearchProjectDef.description: Develop matchlock firing systems that use a slow-burning match cord to ignite gunpowder. These early firearms require constant attention to keep the match lit but offer greater reliability than hand cannons.

ResearchProjectDef.label: wheellock mechanisms
ResearchProjectDef.description: Master the complex wheellock system that uses a spinning steel wheel against pyrite to create sparks. More expensive than matchlocks but eliminates the need for a burning match, making them ideal for cavalry and wet conditions.

ResearchProjectDef.label: wheellock rifling
ResearchProjectDef.description: Combine wheellock reliability with rifled barrels for improved accuracy. These precision weapons are favored by wealthy hunters and elite military units who can afford the extra manufacturing cost.

ResearchProjectDef.label: musket attachments
ResearchProjectDef.description: Develop various attachments and accessories for firearms - bayonet lugs, sling swivels, and ramrod guides. These improvements enhance the versatility and battlefield effectiveness of firearms.

ResearchProjectDef.label: advanced flintlock designs
ResearchProjectDef.description: Push flintlock technology to its limits with innovative designs - multi-barrel systems, improved lock mechanisms, and experimental firing systems. These weapons represent the pinnacle of pre-industrial firearms technology.

ResearchProjectDef.label: improvised firearms
ResearchProjectDef.description: Learn to craft functional firearms from scavenged materials - pipes, wood scraps, and salvaged metal. These crude but effective weapons can be built when proper manufacturing isn't available.

ResearchProjectDef.label: percussion cap systems
ResearchProjectDef.description: Develop the revolutionary percussion cap system using mercury fulminate. This innovation provides more reliable ignition than flintlocks, especially in adverse weather conditions, marking the transition to the industrial age of firearms.

ResearchProjectDef.label: metallic cartridges
ResearchProjectDef.description: Perfect the self-contained metallic cartridge that combines bullet, powder, and primer in a single unit. This breakthrough technology enables rapid reloading and more reliable ammunition storage.

ResearchProjectDef.label: caplock conversions
ResearchProjectDef.description: Learn to convert existing flintlock weapons to use percussion caps. This cost-effective upgrade improves reliability without requiring completely new weapons, extending the service life of existing firearms.

ResearchProjectDef.label: repeating mechanisms
ResearchProjectDef.description: Develop multi-shot firearms using lever-action, revolver, and magazine-fed systems. These complex mechanisms allow multiple shots without complete reloading, revolutionizing combat effectiveness.

ResearchProjectDef.label: advanced repeating systems
ResearchProjectDef.description: Perfect sophisticated repeating mechanisms with improved reliability and capacity. These weapons represent the cutting edge of mechanical firearm design before the advent of modern manufacturing.

ResearchProjectDef.label: advanced breech-loading systems
ResearchProjectDef.description: Master sophisticated breech-loading mechanisms that allow loading from the rear of the barrel. These weapons offer faster reloading and better gas sealing than muzzle-loaders, representing the final evolution of single-shot firearms.
